sentences.en: " Listen, Tom. If you're such a snob, why did you invite him to lunch? "
sentences.cn: “ 我说, 汤姆, 你既然这样瞧不起人, 那么为什么请他吃午饭 呢 ? ”

sentences.en: B: If you think that way, you are a snob already.
sentences.cn: 如果你那样想的话, 你已经是势利小人了.

sentences.en: Going to a private school had made her a snob.
sentences.cn: 上私立学校后，她变得很势利。

sentences.en: He's a bit of a snob won't speak to the likes of me.
sentences.cn: 他这个人有点势利--不会和我这样的人说话.

sentences.en: He's a snob, deceiving his superiors and delude his subordinates.
sentences.cn: 他是个势力小人, 欺上瞒下.

sentences.en: I don’t want to sound like a snob, but I thought she was vulgar.
sentences.cn: 我不想像个势利小人，但我觉得她就是庸俗。

sentences.en: I was a thorough little academic snob.
sentences.cn: 我那时是个目空一切、自以为是的小学术愤青。

sentences.en: Jason: Face it, you don't like action movies because you're a snob.
sentences.cn: 杰森: 承认吧, 你不喜欢动作片是因为你自己势利.

sentences.en: People want to buy designer labels for snob value.
sentences.cn: 人们想买名牌是为了满足虚荣心。
她自以为才智高人一等。

sentences.en: That Rous was a snob and a social climber could scarcely be denied.
sentences.cn: 劳斯十分势利，喜欢攀龙附凤——这几乎是不可否认的事实。

sentences.en: The word gentleman has tended to be a term of abuse , first cousin to snob.
sentences.cn: 绅士这个字成了受人诅咒的名词,意思和势利鬼不相上下.

sentences.en: This car sells well because of its snob value.
sentences.cn: 这种汽车很有派头,因此很畅销.

sentences.en: This part of the town have a lot of snob appeal.
sentences.cn: 该城的这一区很能吸引自视甚高的人.

words.tran_cn: 势利，谄上欺下；摆绅士架子；势利的行为或语言
势利小人,利己主义者,吹牛家

trans.tran_cn: 势利小人，势利眼，附庸风雅之徒，假内行
trans.tran_en: someone who thinks they are better than people from a lower social class – used to show disapproval
